timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Applied because it will generate a new result with every call so immutability isn't required.
replies.author: wborn

timeline.bodyText: This looks to be duplicate code from above.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Not exactly. The difference is that one adds and the other removes the path.
replies.author: wborn

timeline.bodyText: What do these changes have to do with this PR?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
The -fixupmessages is required for embedding the jython JAR. Without this config Bnd errors. By adding it this way future add-ons can also use it. The only other way I see to customize the bnd instructions would be to duplicate the whole plugin configuration in each add-on POM.
If possible I would prefer to start using bnd.bnd files similarly like we do in the core and osgiify. That would provide an easier and more standard way to customize the bnd instructions per add-on. It might also fix the issue of always having to add all those optional imports for embedded JARs. You can see that in #7208 adding all those optional imports wasn't necessary for the embedded JAR.
replies.author: wborn

timeline.message:
Address review comments

Signed-off-by: Wouter Born <github@maindrain.net>

timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Thanks for testing! The issue is that the org.openhab.core.automation.module.script.ScriptEngineFactory.ENGINE_MANAGER has a different classloader. So it only detects engines that are on the boot classpath (like Nashorn). I ran into the same issue with the Groovy add-on. I looked into ways to get engines registered in the ScriptEngineFactory.ENGINE_MANAGER. IIRC it wasn't possible to call methods on ScriptEngineFactory.ENGINE_MANAGER to (un)register engines provided by OSGi bundles.
replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText:
Do you have any concerns regarding SecurityException which might be thrown by this method?

We don't seem to handle any SecurityExceptions in openhab-core either when modifying System properties:
https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/search?q=System.setProperty
replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText: Do we need to handle it?
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
Ah, okay. Sounds reasonable. Thanks for clarification.

Do we need to handle it?

I think it is okay to not handle it. If the exceptions will be thrown there might be a bigger issue regarding permissions and other stuff will fail too.
replies.author: cweitkamp
